Introduction

BuzzGuy was developed as part of an educational project in the Georgia Tech Online Master of Science in Computer Science (OMSCS) program. The goal of this project is to support students’ academic motivation and promote well-being by providing a combination of open-ended and guided conversational responses. This app is provided for educational and research purposes only and is not an official Georgia Tech product.

Collected Data

BuzzGuy does not intend to collect and store personal data. However, some technical and usage data may be processed automatically through third-party services used by the app, such as:

string-array.name: policy_bullets_1
string-array.item: Firebase (Google Services): Used for analytics, crash reporting, and optional app functionality. Firebase may collect non-personal devices and usage data.
Gemini API (Google AI): Processes the text you input to generate chatbot responses. Your chat messages are sent securely to Google’s AI service for processing.

resources.string:
No user accounts or personally identifiable data (e.g., name, email, student ID) are collected or stored by the developer.


How Data Is Used

Any data processed through BuzzGuy is used solely to enable chatbot functionality and improve app performance. The developer does not analyze, share, or sell user data.

Third-party providers (Firebase and Gemini API) may use anonymized and aggregated data as described in their own privacy policies:

Data Storage and Retention

BuzzGuy temporarily stores user chat history to improve usability and allow users to view recent conversations.

string-array.name: policy_bullets_3
string-array.item: The app keeps up to the last 20 messages for each user.
Chat history and user identifiers are automatically deleted after 30 days of inactivity.
If the user uninstalls the app, the anonymous authentication linked to their session will be removed, and the associated chat history will also be permanently deleted.

resources.string:
Once deleted, this data cannot be recovered.

No personal information other than a temporary user ID is stored, and this ID is used only to manage chat sessions. All stored data is kept securely and is never shared, sold, or used for any other purpose.


Data Security

BuzzGuy uses Google Firebase’s built-in secure proxy to manage API communication and data storage. All chat messages and related data are transmitted through Firebase using encrypted HTTPS connections. This setup helps protect user data by keeping API credentials secure and preventing direct external access.

Firebase also provides data encryption and access control as part of Google Cloud’s standard security measures. While we take reasonable precautions to protect data, no method of transmission or storage can guarantee absolute security.
